page.title: 10Craig-yr-Allt Farm.
page.content: Craig-yr-Allt is situated on the mountain track leading from Caerphilly to Taffs Well. It is now a riding school and sheep enterprise known as Rockwood. It was formerly the site of a colliery and several drift mines. In the period 1650-1709 the farmhouse was used as a non-conformist church. The present owners have converted many of the old mining buildings into stables as well as erecting a large indoor riding school. Where the subsidence has occurred due to mining much of the land has been reclaimed, however the scars of mining still exist, even in the mountainside of Craig-yr-Allt, some 273m in height.
